attributes.action: Hold a second fully informed referendum on Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The people I had listened to had taken oaths to serve the best interests of the country and instead had served only themselves.
In any area of commerce, an agreement built on such falsehoods would easily be reversed in law.
I feel tricked and deeply regret voting to leave the EU.It already feels that our little island is vulnerable and adrift.
The only way to rectify this blatant injustice is to have a replacement referendum after we, the public, have been informed of the actual consequences of leaving the EU rather than the fantasies of disreputable charlatans.
attributes.background:
Having followed the arguments and listened intently to the statements made by parliamentarians and others in high office, I voted leave on June 23rd and encouraged others to follow suit. 
by June 25th it became clear that those statements and arguments were at best misinformation or simply lies.
